annapurna-circuit.name: Annapurna Circuit
annapurna-circuit.whySpecial: The Annapurna Circuit traverses a complete spectrum of climatic zones, from subtropical valleys to high alpine desert, circling one of the Himalaya's most formidable massifs. The route crosses Thorong La pass and moves through traditional villages where Buddhist and Hindu cultures converge. This trek reveals both the raw power of high Himalayan terrain and the enduring rhythms of mountain life.
highlights: Thorong La pass crossing at high altitude
Marsyangdi and Kali Gandaki river valleys
Gurung and Thakali villages with distinct cultural traditions
Manang's alpine setting beneath glaciated peaks
Varied landscapes from rice terraces to arid highlands
Buddhist monasteries and prayer flag-draped ridges

everest-base-camp.name: Everest Base Camp
everest-base-camp.whySpecial: This route follows the footsteps of mountaineering expeditions toward the base of the world's highest peak, winding through the Khumbu Valley beneath a horizon dominated by monumental summits. Sherpa villages and Buddhist monasteries mark the ascent through rhododendron forests and rocky moraines. The journey offers an immersion in both high-altitude landscape and the culture that has thrived in its shadow for generations.
highlights: Tengboche Monastery with Ama Dablam views
Khumbu Icefall visible from base camp
Kala Patthar viewpoint facing Everest's south face
High-altitude river valleys and glacial terrain
Buddhist stupas and prayer wheels along the trail

tour-du-mont-blanc.name: Tour du Mont Blanc
tour-du-mont-blanc.whySpecial: Circling the Mont Blanc massif, this route crosses multiple mountain passes and national borders, weaving through Alpine valleys shaped by glaciers and centuries of human settlement. The trek transitions between French, Italian, and Swiss landscapes, each offering distinct architecture, cuisine, and mountain culture. High meadows, limestone ridges, and glaciated peaks define the visual rhythm of this classic Alpine traverse.
highlights: Col du Bonhomme and other Alpine passes
Traditional Alpine hamlets and farming valleys

torres-del-paine-o.name: Torres del Paine (O)
torres-del-paine-o.whySpecial: The O Circuit encircles the Torres del Paine massif through Patagonian steppe, glacial valleys, and subantarctic beech forests, revealing the raw forces that continue to shape this southern wilderness. Wind-sculpted landscapes open onto views of granite spires, turquoise lakes, and the Southern Patagonian Ice Field. This trek offers a complete experience of one of South America's most dramatic mountain environments.
highlights: Grey Glacier and ice field views
Valle del Francés with hanging glaciers

pct-high-sierra.name: PCT (High Sierra)
pct-high-sierra.whySpecial: This section of the Pacific Crest Trail traverses California's High Sierra through granite wilderness, alpine lakes, and meadows beneath some of North America's highest peaks. The route follows John Muir's Range of Light across remote backcountry where glacial processes continue to reshape the landscape. Extended stretches above treeline reveal the Sierra's characteristic domes, cirques, and polished granite surfaces.
highlights: Whitney Portal and Forester Pass crossings
Sequoia and Kings Canyon high country
Thousand Island Lake beneath Banner Peak

kilimanjaro-machame.name: Kilimanjaro (Machame)
kilimanjaro-machame.whySpecial: The Machame Route ascends through distinct ecological zones toward the volcanic summit of Africa's highest mountain, from rainforest to alpine desert and finally to glaciated summit terrain. The route approaches Uhuru Peak through Barranco Wall and high camps perched on volcanic ridges. This trek offers passage through dramatically changing environments and the experience of equatorial high-altitude conditions.
highlights: Barranco Wall scramble and volcanic formations
Summit crater rim at Uhuru Peak

laugavegur-trail.name: Laugavegur Trail
laugavegur-trail.whySpecial: The Laugavegur Trail crosses Iceland's volcanic interior through geothermal valleys, obsidian deserts, and glacier-fed rivers, traversing terrain shaped by ongoing volcanic and glacial activity. Rhyolite mountains give way to black sand plains and moss-covered lava fields. This trek reveals a landscape in constant flux, where elemental forces remain visible and active.
highlights: Landmannalaugar's rhyolite peaks and hot springs
Volcanic black sand and ash fields

routeburn-track.name: Routeburn Track
routeburn-track.whySpecial: The Routeburn Track traverses New Zealand's Southern Alps through beech forests, alpine valleys, and mountain passes that connect two national parks. The route follows ancient Māori greenstone trading paths through terrain carved by glaciers and sculpted by heavy rainfall. Waterfalls, tarns, and snow-capped peaks define this passage through temperate rainforest and subalpine environments.
highlights: Harris Saddle and Conical Hill viewpoint

gr20.name: GR20
gr20.whySpecial: The GR20 follows the spine of Corsica from north to south through granite peaks, pine forests, and rocky ridges that demand continuous scrambling and navigation. The route traverses some of Europe's most rugged terrain, passing through landscapes shaped by Mediterranean climate and geological upheaval. This trek offers relentless verticality and exposure to Corsica's wild interior.
highlights: Cirque de la Solitude and Monte Cinto massif

snowman-trek.name: Snowman Trek
snowman-trek.whySpecial: The Snowman Trek crosses multiple high passes through Bhutan's remote northern highlands, traversing terrain rarely visited even by Bhutanese locals. The route passes glacial lakes, yak-herding settlements, and Buddhist monasteries in landscapes where Himalayan peaks dominate the horizon. This trek represents one of the most demanding high-altitude journeys accessible to trekkers, moving through a region where traditional mountain culture remains largely unchanged.
highlights: Gangkhar Puensum and surrounding Himalayan giants
Yak herder camps and highland pastures
Prayer flags marking high mountain crossings

overland-track.name: Overland Track
overland-track.whySpecial: The Overland Track cuts through Tasmania's central highlands, traversing alpine plateaus, ancient rainforests, and glacial valleys within a temperate wilderness. The route passes Cradle Mountain and follows boardwalks across buttongrass moorlands dotted with glacial tarns. This trek offers immersion in an environment where Gondwanan plant species persist and weather patterns shift rapidly across exposed ridges.
highlights: Lake St Clair and surrounding peaks
Ancient myrtle and King Billy pine forests

kungsleden.name: Kungsleden
kungsleden.whySpecial: The Kungsleden traverses Swedish Lapland through birch forests, mountain plateaus, and tundra landscapes within the Arctic Circle. The route passes Sami settlements and crosses terrain where reindeer migrations follow ancient patterns. Extended daylight during summer months reveals a northern wilderness shaped by glaciers and characterized by vast open horizons.
highlights: Sami cultural sites and reindeer herding areas

milford-track.name: Milford Track
milford-track.whySpecial: The Milford Track follows a glacially carved valley through Fiordland's temperate rainforest, passing beneath towering waterfalls and granite peaks draped in permanent snowfields. The route crosses Mackinnon Pass and descends toward Milford Sound through landscapes receiving extraordinary rainfall. This trek moves through one of the world's most intact temperate ecosystems, where geological drama and ecological richness converge.
highlights: Mackinnon Pass crossing beneath Mount Balloon
Ancient beech forest and fern gullies

camino-de-santiago.name: Camino de Santiago
camino-de-santiago.whySpecial: The Camino Frances crosses northern Spain through wheat fields, medieval villages, and mountain passes, following a pilgrimage route walked for over a millennium. The path connects Romanesque churches, monasteries, and towns shaped by centuries of religious and cultural exchange. This trek offers both physical passage across varied Iberian landscapes and connection to a living tradition that continues to draw walkers from around the world.

annapurna-base-camp-abc.name: Annapurna Base Camp (ABC)
annapurna-base-camp-abc.whySpecial: This route ascends through terraced farmland and rhododendron forests into the Annapurna Sanctuary, a high-altitude basin surrounded by some of the Himalaya's most formidable peaks. The trail enters a natural amphitheater where glaciers descend from walls rising directly overhead. The trek offers intimate proximity to towering summits and passage through Gurung villages that maintain traditional mountain agriculture.

mount-fuji.name: Mount Fuji
mount-fuji.whySpecial: Mount Fuji's ascent follows volcanic trails through forest zones to alpine desert and finally to the summit crater of Japan's most iconic peak. The route passes mountain huts and torii gates, ascending through elevation zones that mark both ecological and spiritual transitions. This trek offers passage up a near-perfect volcanic cone that has shaped Japanese culture and art for centuries.
highlights: Summit crater rim and sunrise views
Volcanic scree fields and lava formations
Mountain huts at different elevation stations
Views across the Kanto Plain and Pacific

mount-kailash-kora.name: Mount Kailash Kora
mount-kailash-kora.whySpecial: The kora circumambulates Mount Kailash through the high Tibetan Plateau, following a pilgrimage route sacred to multiple religions. The circuit crosses Drolma La pass and traverses barren valleys where prayer flags mark the path. This trek offers passage through landscapes of stark beauty and profound cultural significance, where the act of walking carries spiritual weight for pilgrims from across Asia.
highlights: Drolma La pass with prayer flags
Pilgrims performing prostrations along the route

west-coast-trail.name: West Coast Trail
west-coast-trail.whySpecial: The West Coast Trail follows Vancouver Island's rugged Pacific coastline through temperate rainforest, along rocky beaches, and across surge channels carved by ocean swells. The route traces a historic lifesaving path built for shipwreck survivors. This trek offers immersion in one of North America's most productive marine and terrestrial ecosystems, where massive trees, tidal pools, and sea stacks define the coastal wilderness.
highlights: Pacific coastal headlands and sea caves
Ancient Sitka spruce and cedar forests
Tidal surge channels and suspension bridges
Marine wildlife including whales and sea lions
Rugged beaches with offshore rock formations

walkers-haute-route.name: Walker's Haute Route
walkers-haute-route.whySpecial: The Haute Route traverses the Alps from Chamonix to Zermatt through high mountain passes and glacier-fed valleys beneath some of Europe's most celebrated peaks. The route connects Swiss and French Alpine regions through terrain demanding sustained high-altitude travel. This trek offers continuous exposure to glaciated summits and passage through mountain landscapes that have defined European alpinism.

karakoram-baltoro.name: Karakoram Baltoro
karakoram-baltoro.whySpecial: The Baltoro Glacier trek approaches K2 through one of the world's most concentrated assemblages of high peaks, following a massive glacier corridor flanked by granite spires and ice walls. The route passes Concordia, where multiple glaciers converge beneath summits exceeding considerable elevation. This trek offers passage through the Karakoram's most dramatic terrain, where scale and remoteness define the experience.

drakensberg-grand-traverse.name: Drakensberg Grand Traverse
drakensberg-grand-traverse.whySpecial: The Grand Traverse follows the high escarpment of South Africa's Drakensberg through grasslands, sandstone formations, and basalt cliffs that rise abruptly from surrounding lowlands. The route crosses mountain passes and traverses terrain inhabited by eland and other highland fauna. This trek offers sustained ridge walking through landscapes where San rock art documents millennia of human presence.
highlights: Escarpment ridge walking and high passes
San rock art sites in cave shelters

huayhuash-circuit.name: Huayhuash Circuit
huayhuash-circuit.whySpecial: The Huayhuash Circuit encircles one of Peru's most dramatic mountain ranges through high passes and remote valleys beneath glaciated peaks. The route traverses terrain where traditional herding communities maintain seasonal camps. This trek offers sustained high-altitude travel through landscapes of exceptional verticality and glacial presence.
highlights: Multiple high passes with glacier views

alta-via-1.name: Alta Via 1
alta-via-1.whySpecial: Alta Via 1 traverses the Dolomites from north to south through limestone towers, alpine meadows, and valleys shaped by erosion and uplift. The route passes mountain rifugios and connects valleys through terrain where rock climbing and mountaineering traditions remain strong. This trek offers passage through landscapes where pale limestone formations rise dramatically against Alpine skies.
highlights: Via ferrata routes on surrounding peaks

alta-via-2.name: Alta Via 2
alta-via-2.whySpecial: Alta Via 2 extends deeper into the Dolomites through more remote terrain and higher passes than its northern counterpart. The route traverses beneath Marmolada and other glaciated peaks through landscapes where limestone geology creates dramatic vertical relief. This trek offers extended immersion in Dolomite wilderness with sustained elevation gain and loss.
highlights: Passo di Ball and other high crossings
Pale di San Martino limestone group

alta-via-4.name: Alta Via 4
alta-via-4.whySpecial: Alta Via 4 follows a less-traveled route through the Dolomites, connecting valleys and passes through terrain offering solitude and technical challenges. The circuit moves through landscapes where limestone pinnacles rise above forested valleys. This trek provides access to Dolomite environments away from more frequented routes.
highlights: San Pellegrino Pass and surrounding peaks

manaslu-circuit.name: Manaslu Circuit
manaslu-circuit.whySpecial: The Manaslu Circuit circles the world's eighth-highest peak through valleys that have only recently opened to trekkers. The route crosses Larkya La pass and traverses terrain where Tibetan Buddhist culture predominates. This trek offers passage through landscapes retaining a sense of remoteness and traditional mountain life less affected by tourism.
highlights: Larkya La pass with Manaslu views

salkantay-trek.name: Salkantay Trek
salkantay-trek.whySpecial: The Salkantay Trek approaches Machu Picchu through high passes beneath glaciated peaks and descends through cloud forest into the subtropical Urubamba Valley. The route offers an alternative to the Inca Trail through landscapes transitioning from alpine to tropical. This trek combines dramatic mountain scenery with ecological diversity and archaeological context.
highlights: Machu Picchu approach from the south

peaks-of-the-balkans.name: Peaks of the Balkans
peaks-of-the-balkans.whySpecial: This route crosses the borders of Albania, Kosovo, and Montenegro through limestone mountains and glacial valleys where traditional mountain culture persists. The trek passes through villages where shepherding and subsistence agriculture continue as they have for generations. This circuit offers passage through landscapes shaped by both geological forces and human history in a region where cultural traditions remain deeply rooted.

markha-valley.name: Markha Valley
markha-valley.whySpecial: The Markha Valley trek crosses Ladakh's high desert through Buddhist villages and beneath peaks that rise abruptly from barren valleys. The route traverses terrain where water is scarce and settlements cluster around streams. This trek offers passage through landscapes where Tibetan Buddhist culture thrives in one of the world's highest inhabited regions.

lycian-way.name: Lycian Way
lycian-way.whySpecial: The Lycian Way follows Turkey's Mediterranean coast through pine forests, ancient ruins, and clifftop paths overlooking turquoise waters. The route connects Lycian cities and tombs carved into cliff faces. This trek offers passage through landscapes where classical history, coastal scenery, and rural Turkish life converge.
highlights: Lycian rock tombs and ancient cities

kumano-kodo.name: Kumano Kodo
kumano-kodo.whySpecial: The Kumano Kodo follows ancient pilgrimage routes through the forested mountains of the Kii Peninsula, connecting Shinto shrines revered for over a millennium. The trails pass through cedar groves, alongside waterfalls, and over mountain passes marked by stone monuments. This trek offers passage through landscapes imbued with spiritual significance and natural beauty in equal measure.

arctic-circle-trail.name: Arctic Circle Trail
arctic-circle-trail.whySpecial: The Arctic Circle Trail crosses Greenland's ice-free interior through tundra, glacier-fed rivers, and landscapes shaped by continuous permafrost. The route passes abandoned settlements and traverses terrain where caribou migrate and muskoxen graze. This trek offers extended immersion in Arctic wilderness where summer's brief intensity is followed by months of darkness and ice.
highlights: Ice sheet views from inland hills

fishermans-trail.name: Fisherman's Trail
fishermans-trail.whySpecial: The Fisherman's Trail follows Portugal's Atlantic coastline through fishing villages, across clifftops, and along beaches where the ocean's force has carved dramatic rock formations. The route traces paths used by local fishermen for generations. This trek offers sustained coastal walking through landscapes where maritime culture and natural beauty shape the experience.

simien-mountains.name: Simien Mountains
simien-mountains.whySpecial: The Simien Mountains trek traverses Ethiopia's highest ranges through landscapes of dramatic escarpments, deep gorges, and afroalpine moorlands. The route passes through habitat for endemic wildlife including gelada baboons and Ethiopian wolves. This trek offers passage through terrain where geological upheaval has created one of Africa's most distinctive mountain environments.

ausangate-circuit.name: Ausangate Circuit
ausangate-circuit.whySpecial: The Ausangate Circuit circles a sacred peak in the Peruvian Andes through high passes and past glacial lakes in shades of turquoise and emerald. The route traverses terrain where traditional herding communities maintain llama and alpaca flocks. This trek offers sustained high-altitude travel through landscapes of intense color and spiritual significance to local Quechua communities.

gokyo-lakes.name: Gokyo Lakes
gokyo-lakes.whySpecial: The Gokyo Lakes trek ascends the Dudh Kosi valley to a chain of turquoise glacial lakes beneath Cho Oyu. The route offers an alternative perspective on the Khumbu region, with Gokyo Ri providing panoramic views of Himalayan giants. This trek combines Sherpa cultural immersion with high-altitude lake scenery and glacier travel.

banff-highline.name: Banff Highline
banff-highline.whySpecial: The Banff Highline traverses the Canadian Rockies through alpine meadows, conifer forests, and passes beneath limestone peaks. The route connects valleys through terrain where grizzly bears and elk range. This trek offers extended backcountry travel through one of North America's most protected mountain ecosystems.

coast-to-coast.name: Coast to Coast
coast-to-coast.whySpecial: The Coast to Coast walk crosses northern England from the Irish Sea to the North Sea through the Lake District, Yorkshire Dales, and North York Moors. The route traverses varied terrain including mountain passes, limestone valleys, and moorland. This trek offers passage through landscapes shaped by both natural forces and centuries of human habitation.

tongariro-circuit.name: Tongariro Circuit
tongariro-circuit.whySpecial: The Tongariro Circuit circles a volcanic massif through landscapes of active geothermal features, crater lakes, and lava flows. The route crosses emerald and blue crater lakes and traverses terrain where volcanic processes remain visible. This trek offers passage through New Zealand's most accessible volcanic environment.
highlights: Views across the North Island volcanic plateau

mount-kenya.name: Mount Kenya
mount-kenya.whySpecial: Mount Kenya's circuits ascend through montane forests, bamboo zones, and alpine moorlands to glaciated peaks near the equator. The route passes through ecosystems hosting unique afroalpine flora. This trek offers passage through elevation zones where tropical and alpine conditions intersect.

wonderland-trail.name: Wonderland Trail
wonderland-trail.whySpecial: The Wonderland Trail circumnavigates Mount Rainier through old-growth forests, wildflower meadows, and glacial valleys beneath the volcano's massive summit. The route crosses ridges offering perspectives on Rainier's glaciers and traverses watersheds radiating from the peak. This trek provides continuous immersion in Pacific Northwest wilderness.

fitz-roy-trek.name: Fitz Roy Trek
fitz-roy-trek.whySpecial: The Fitz Roy trek approaches one of Patagonia's most distinctive granite spires through lenga forests and glacial valleys. The route offers views of the Fitz Roy massif and surrounding peaks from multiple vantage points. This trek provides access to Argentine Patagonia's iconic mountain scenery within a concentrated area.
highlights: Laguna de los Tres glacial tarn

east-coast-trail.name: East Coast Trail
east-coast-trail.whySpecial: The East Coast Trail follows Newfoundland's Atlantic coastline through fishing outports, across headlands, and along cliffs where seabirds nest in vast colonies. The route traces paths through landscapes shaped by maritime weather and centuries of coastal settlement. This trek offers sustained ocean views and access to isolated coves and cultural sites.
highlights: Atlantic coastal cliffs and sea stacks
Icebergs in spring and early summer

triglav-circuit.name: Triglav Circuit
triglav-circuit.whySpecial: The Triglav Circuit encircles Slovenia's highest peak through Julian Alps terrain of limestone karst, alpine meadows, and glacial valleys. The route passes mountain huts and traverses landscapes where Slovenian alpinism developed. This trek offers passage through compact Alpine scenery with sustained verticality.
highlights: Views across Slovenia and into Italy

kalalau-trail.name: Kalalau Trail
kalalau-trail.whySpecial: The Kalalau Trail follows Kauai's Na Pali coastline across stream-cut valleys and beneath fluted cliffs rising directly from the Pacific. The route traverses terrain where native Hawaiian vegetation persists and archaeological sites mark ancient settlements. This trek offers sustained exposure to one of Hawaii's most dramatic coastal landscapes.
highlights: Na Pali Coast cliffs and valleys

larapinta-trail.name: Larapinta Trail
larapinta-trail.whySpecial: The Larapinta Trail traverses the West MacDonnell Ranges through red quartzite ridges, desert gorges, and waterholes that have sustained life in Australia's arid interior for millennia. The route passes through landscapes sacred to the Arrernte people and offers views across seemingly endless desert horizons. This trek provides immersion in Central Australian environments where water scarcity shapes all life.

tiger-leaping-gorge.name: Tiger Leaping Gorge
tiger-leaping-gorge.whySpecial: Tiger Leaping Gorge follows a trail carved into cliff walls high above the Jinsha River as it cuts through one of the world's deepest gorges. The route offers constant views of Jade Dragon Snow Mountain and the river far below. This trek provides passage through dramatic terrain where scale and verticality define the experience.

west-highland-way.name: West Highland Way
west-highland-way.whySpecial: The West Highland Way crosses the Scottish Highlands from lowlands to mountains through glens, alongside lochs, and over moorland. The route traverses terrain shaped by volcanic activity, glaciation, and centuries of clan history. This trek offers passage through landscapes where Highland culture and natural beauty remain intertwined.

santa-cruz-trek.name: Santa Cruz Trek
santa-cruz-trek.whySpecial: The Santa Cruz Trek crosses Peru's Cordillera Blanca through glaciated valleys beneath some of the Andes' highest tropical peaks. The route passes turquoise lakes and traverses high passes with views of ice-covered summits. This trek offers concentrated exposure to Andean mountain scenery in a relatively compact route.
highlights: Laguna Churup and other glacial lakes

lost-city-trek.name: Lost City Trek
lost-city-trek.whySpecial: The Lost City trek ascends through Colombia's Sierra Nevada cloud forests to Teyuna, an archaeological site predating Machu Picchu. The route crosses rivers and climbs stone steps through terrain where indigenous Kogi communities maintain traditional lifestyles. This trek combines archaeological discovery with immersion in tropical mountain environments.

acatenango-fuego.name: Acatenango-Fuego
acatenango-fuego.whySpecial: This ascent climbs Acatenango volcano for views of neighboring Fuego's constant eruptions. The route passes through agricultural lands and pine forests before emerging onto volcanic slopes. This trek offers the experience of observing active volcanism from a safe vantage point while camping on a dormant volcano's flanks.
highlights: Fuego's active eruptions at close range
Volcanic ash fields and lava formations

el-choro-trek.name: El Choro Trek
el-choro-trek.whySpecial: El Choro descends from the Bolivian altiplano through cloud forests to subtropical valleys, following a pre-Columbian trade route. The route traverses multiple ecological zones in rapid succession. This trek offers dramatic transitions from high Andean environments to jungle lowlands.

cordillera-real.name: Cordillera Real
cordillera-real.whySpecial: The Cordillera Real traverse crosses multiple passes through glaciated peaks rising above Bolivia's high plateau. The route passes mining communities and traverses terrain where traditional Aymara culture persists. This trek offers sustained high-altitude travel through landscapes of stark beauty and cultural depth.

mgoun-traverse.name: Mgoun Traverse
mgoun-traverse.whySpecial: The Mgoun Traverse crosses Morocco's High Atlas through Berber villages, river gorges, and high passes beneath North Africa's second-highest peak. The route traverses landscapes where traditional agropastoral life continues in isolated valleys. This trek offers passage through terrain where geology and culture create distinctive mountain environments.

toubkal-circuit.name: Toubkal Circuit
toubkal-circuit.whySpecial: The Toubkal Circuit circles North Africa's highest peak through Berber villages, walnut groves, and high passes in the Atlas Mountains. The route traverses terrain where traditional mountain life adapts to extreme seasonal conditions. This trek offers immersion in Moroccan mountain culture alongside approaches to Toubkal's summit.

rwenzori-mountains.name: Rwenzori Mountains
rwenzori-mountains.whySpecial: The Rwenzori trek ascends through equatorial rainforests, bamboo zones, and alpine moorlands to glaciated peaks on the Uganda-Congo border. The route passes through ecosystems of exceptional biodiversity. This trek offers passage through elevation zones where African and alpine environments create unique combinations of flora and fauna.

mestia-to-ushguli.name: Mestia to Ushguli
mestia-to-ushguli.whySpecial: This route crosses Georgia's Upper Svaneti through valleys dominated by defensive towers and beneath Caucasus peaks. The trail connects medieval villages where Svan culture and architecture remain intact. This trek offers passage through landscapes where mountain isolation has preserved unique cultural traditions.

caucasus-tusheti.name: Caucasus (Tusheti)
caucasus-tusheti.whySpecial: The Tusheti trek crosses remote valleys in Georgia's northeastern Caucasus through landscapes where traditional shepherding continues in seasonal settlements. The route traverses high passes and follows trails connecting villages accessible only part of the year. This trek offers immersion in one of the Caucasus's most isolated regions.

altai-mountains.name: Altai Mountains
altai-mountains.whySpecial: The Altai trek traverses southern Siberia's mountains through taiga forests, alpine meadows, and valleys where nomadic cultures persist. The route crosses terrain where Russian, Mongolian, Chinese, and Kazakh borders converge. This trek offers passage through landscapes where Central Asian and Siberian environments meet.

yading-kora.name: Yading Kora
yading-kora.whySpecial: The Yading Kora circles three sacred peaks in Sichuan's highlands through alpine meadows and forests where Tibetan pilgrims perform ritual circumambulations. The route traverses terrain where Buddhist spirituality and mountain scenery converge. This trek offers passage through landscapes of religious significance and natural beauty in China's western mountains.
highlights: Milk Lake and Pearl Lake tarns

fish-river-canyon.name: Fish River Canyon
fish-river-canyon.whySpecial: The Fish River Canyon trek descends into one of Africa's largest canyons, following the riverbed through arid desert landscapes carved over millions of years. The route traverses terrain where water is scarce and temperatures extreme. This trek offers passage through geological formations of immense age in southern Namibia's remote interior.
highlights: Fish River pools and hot springs
Arid zone flora adapted to extremes
Views from canyon rim and floor

mount-hood-timberline.name: Mount Hood Timberline
mount-hood-timberline.whySpecial: The Timberline Trail circles Mount Hood through old-growth forests, across glacial streams, and past waterfalls beneath Oregon's highest peak. The route traverses terrain where volcanic activity has shaped valleys and created distinct ecosystems. This trek offers passage through Pacific Northwest wilderness within view of Portland's urban area.

huemul-circuit.name: Huemul Circuit
huemul-circuit.whySpecial: The Huemul Circuit traverses southern Patagonia through lenga forests and alongside glacial lakes beneath the Fitz Roy massif. The route crosses technical sections requiring basic mountaineering skills. This trek offers passage through landscapes where ice, rock, and forest create dramatic contrasts in a remote corner of Argentina.
highlights: Glacial lakes including Lago del Desierto
Technical rope sections and glacier crossings

mount-rinjani.name: Mount Rinjani
mount-rinjani.whySpecial: Mount Rinjani's ascent climbs an active volcano to a summit crater containing a crescent lake and smaller volcanic cone. The route traverses savanna, montane forest, and volcanic slopes. This trek offers views across Lombok and neighboring islands from one of Indonesia's most sacred peaks.

ala-kul-and-altyn-arashan.name: Ala-Kul & Altyn-Arashan
ala-kul-and-altyn-arashan.whySpecial: This Kyrgyz trek crosses a high pass between two mountain valleys, passing an alpine lake and natural hot springs beneath the Terskey Alatau range. The route traverses terrain where Soviet-era mountaineering infrastructure meets traditional nomadic culture. This trek offers passage through Central Asian mountain scenery with opportunities for cultural exchange.
